description: Maya instructor tools for grading and managing student assignments across NMSU's FDMA courses for the Creative Media Institute (CMI)
author: Alexander T. Santiago

releases.description: Initial release of Prof-Tools framework with core functionality and manifest-based versioning
features: Drag-and-drop installer with simple installation process
Universal grading engine for consistent logic across courses
Configurable rubrics for class and assignment-specific criteria
Automated analysis capabilities for file validation and scene checks
Menu-based interface integrated into Maya's main interface
Robust version utilities with caching and fallback mechanisms
SSL-secured manifest fetching with proper error handling
Local-first manifest reading with remote fallback
Fixed commit hash to use master branch for automatic updates
Professional update dialog with comprehensive version comparison
Enhanced Help menu with about dialog and quick links
User-friendly update interface designed for advanced Maya users
Automatic update system with one-click download and installation
Immediate menu loading after installation - no Maya restart required
